case_vignette: an 11-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after he was found screaming and clutching his head. he has had nausea and occasional episodes of vomiting for 1 week, fever and left-sided headaches for 2 weeks, and increasing tooth pain over the past 3 weeks. he has no history of ear or sinus infections. he is in moderate distress. his temperature is 38.7°c (101.7°f), pulse is 170/min, respirations are 19/min, and blood pressure is 122/85 mmhg. he is confused and only oriented to person. the pupils react sluggishly to light. fundoscopic examination shows papilledema bilaterally. extraocular movements are normal. flexion of the neck causes hip flexion.
question: which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been feeling nauseous with episodes of vomiting for the past week, I've had a fever and headaches on the left side of my head for two weeks, and my tooth pain has been increasing for the past three weeks.
Have you had any recent injuries, particularly to the head, face, or teeth?
No, I have not had any recent injuries.
Do you have any history of chronic diseases or conditions related to your heart, liver, kidneys, or previous neurological issues?
No, I do not have any history of chronic diseases or previous neurological issues.
Have you noticed any changes in your vision, or have you experienced sensitivity to light or sound?
I haven't noticed changes specifically mentioned about my vision in general, but my pupils are reacting sluggishly to light.
Do you have any family history of migraines or other neurological disorders?
No, I do not have any family history of migraines or other neurological disorders.
Have you experienced any recent changes in your dental health, such as new cavities, dental procedures, or abnormal sensations in your teeth or gums?
No, I haven't had any recent dental procedures or new cavities, but I've been experiencing increasing tooth pain over the past three weeks.
Has the tooth pain been continuously worsening, and can you identify if it is localized to a specific tooth or area of your mouth?
Yes, the tooth pain has been continuously worsening, but I can't specify if it's localized to a specific tooth or area.
Is the tooth pain accompanied by swelling, redness, or discharge in the mouth? Additionally, do you have any issues like bad breath or a foul taste?
No, there's no swelling, redness, or discharge in my mouth, and I haven't mentioned any issues with bad breath or a foul taste.
Final Diagnosis: Trigeminal neuralgia.
